LayoutNode.Content: Japan Post Holdings Co., Ltd. (日本郵政株式会社, Nippon Yū-sei Kabushiki-gaisha) is a Japanese state-owned conglomerate headquartered in Kasumigaseki, Chiyoda, Tokyo. It operates post stations, banks, and insurance business. The company offers letters and goods transportation services, stamp sales, deposits, loans, and insurance products. There were plans to fully privatize the agency but these have been put on hold. As of 2013, it ranked thirteenth in the Fortune Global 500 list of the world's largest companies.
LayoutNode.SRC: Japan Post Holdings Co., Ltd. (日本郵政株式会社, Nippon Yū-sei Kabushiki-gaisha) is a Japanese state-owned conglomerate headquartered in Kasumigaseki, Chiyoda, Tokyo. It operates post stations, banks, and insurance business. The company offers letters and goods transportation services, stamp sales, deposits, loans, and insurance products. There were plans to fully privatize the agency but these have been put on hold. As of 2013, it ranked thirteenth in the Fortune Global 500 list of the world's largest companies.

History

LayoutNode.Content: The company was founded on 23 January 2006, although it was not until October 2007 that it took over the functions of Japan Post.
LayoutNode.SRC: The company was founded on 23 January 2006, although it was not until October 2007 that it took over the functions of Japan Post.
